A Turing test with a fifteen minute time limit is a gimmick. A TT that lasts hours with absolutely no restrictions on the questions seems quite different.

If we achieve AGI won't this be the way we interact with it?

@GaryMarcus @cajundiscordian But if it were a truly open ended hours-long conversation, you could incorporate tests for reasoning, common sense, long term planning, counterfactuals, etc. If it was human level at anything you threw at it, wouldn't that convince you it's AGI?

@GaryMarcus @cajundiscordian Yes, agree that the Turing test is not a great test for true intelligence, but it is still a significant milestone.  Kurzweil has a bet with Mitch Kapor that a system will pass a pretty elaborate, hours-long TT by 2029. I'd say, based on this, he is likely to win.
@GaryMarcus @cajundiscordian Not sentient, but what would Alan Turing say if he saw this? Maybe a pretty good shot at passing his test?
